New Records: Shohei Ohtani became the first major league player to hit 50 home runs and steal 50 bases in a season.
Shohei Ohtani reached the milestone in his 150th game, faster than others who have achieved similar feats.
Key Match Events: Shohei Ohtani hit two home runs, including his 50th, and stole two bases, including his 51st during the game.
Pre-Game Insights: Dodgers' manager Dave Roberts noticed Ohtani's increased aggressiveness on the bases and highlighted his ability to study pitchers and learn tendencies.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Shohei Ohtani's previous career high for steals was 26, and he has been successful on his last 28 stolen base attempts.
Others: Shohei Ohtani did not pitch this season, allowing him to focus on batting and baserunning as the Dodgers' everyday designated hitter.
